snippet: Stephen Colbert became the immediate front-runner for the position both because of an increasing recognition of his talent and because he clearly wanted the job.
abstract: CBS announces Stephen Colbert will succeed David Letterman as host of its late-night franchise, which Letterman created when he came to network in 1993; Colbert became immediate front-runner for position both because of an increasing recognition of his talent and because he clearly wanted the job.

byline.contributor: Dave Itzkoff and Stuart Elliott contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Stephen Colbert became the immediate front-runner for the position both because of an increasing recognition of his talent and because he clearly wanted the job.

headline.main: Colbert Will Host ‘Late Show,’ Playing Himself for a Change
headline.print_headline: Colbert Will Host ‘Late Show,’ Playing Himself for a Change
